description: Demonstrates browser automation for web search. Opens a search engine, performs a search, and extracts results. Shows first-class browser integration with auto-managed subprocess.

cells.name: search
cells.instructions:
You have a browser open to DuckDuckGo.

Your task:
1. First, use extract_page_content to understand the page layout
2. Find the search input field (look at DOM coordinates)
3. Click on the search field
4. Type the search query: {{ input.query }}
5. Press Enter to submit
6. Wait for results to load
7. Extract the search results

Use these commands:
- Move mouse: [":move-mouse", ":to", x, y]
- Click: [":click"]
- Type: [":type", "{{ input.query }}"]
- Press Enter: [":keypress", "Enter"]
- Wait: [":wait", 2]
- Scroll: [":scroll-wheel-down", 3]

The browser session is automatically managed - it started before this phase and will be cleaned up after.

cells.name: summarize
cells.instructions:
Based on the browser automation in the previous phase, summarize what was found.

Previous phase output:
{{ outputs.search }}

Provide a summary of:
1. Whether the search was successful
2. What results were found (if any)
3. Any issues encountered
